qas.question: What was considered to be dominant part of normal life?
What language does the word Music see it's origins in?
Could events in the Roman Republic often include music?

answers.text: Many private and public events were accompanied by music

qas.question: What do many people consider to be the source of our modern musics familiarity with us?

answers.text: developments only within the last 1,000 years

context: <a0_0>Music<a0_0/> was a major part of everyday life.[citation needed] The word itself derives from <a1_0>Greek<a1_0/> μουσική (mousike), "(art) of the Muses". <a2_0>Many private and public events were accompanied by music<a2_0/>, ranging from nightly dining to military parades and manoeuvres. In a discussion of any ancient music, however, non-specialists and even many musicians have to be reminded that much of what makes our modern music familiar to us is the result of <a3_0>developments only within the last 1,000 years<a3_0/>; thus, our ideas of melody, scales, harmony, and even the instruments we use may not have been familiar to Romans who made and listened to music many centuries earlier.[citation needed]
